table-reference.title: Illumination power density adjustment factor for a control device

row.entry: Item Notes 1 and 2
Description
illumination power density adjustment factor
Demand-operated controlsMotion detector
In a toilet or change room, other than a public toilet, in a Class 6 building
Demand-operated controlsMotion detector
Where a group of light fittings serving less than 100 m2 is controlled by one or more detectors
Demand-operated controlsMotion detector
Where a group of light fittings serving 100 m2 or more is controlled by one or more detectors
Programmable dimming system Note 3
Where not less than 75% of the area of a space is controlled by programmable dimmers
Fixed dimming Notes 3 and 4
All fittings with fixed dimming
Whichever is greater of (a) 0.5; or (b) 0.2+0.8L where L = the illuminance turndown for the fixed dimming.
Lumen depreciation dimming Note 3
All fittings with lumen depreciation dimming
Two stage sensor - equipped lights with minimum power of 30 % of peak power or less
Fire stairs and other spaces not used for regular transit
Two stage sensor - equipped lights with minimum power of 30% of peak power or less
Transitory spaces in regular use or in a carpark
Daylight sensor and dynamic lighting control device - dimmed or stepped switching of lights adjacent windows Notes 3 and 5

In a Class 5, 6, 7, 8 or 9b building or a Class 9a building, other than a ward area, where the lights are adjacent windows, other than roof lights, for a distance from the window equal to the depth of the floor to window head height
0.5 Note 3
Daylight sensor and dynamic lighting control device - dimmed or stepped switching of lights adjacent windows Notes 3 and 5

Serving a Class 3 or 9c building, or a Class 9a ward area, where the lights are adjacent windows, other than roof lights, for a distance from the window equal to the depth of the floor to window head height
0.75 Note 3
Daylight sensor and dynamic lighting control device - dimmed or stepped switching of lights adjacent windows Notes 3 and 5
In a Class 5, 6, 7, 8 or 9b building or a Class 9a building, other than a ward area, where the lights are adjacent roof lights
0.6 Note 3
Daylight sensor and dynamic lighting control device - dimmed or stepped switching of lights adjacent windows Notes 3 and 5
In a Class 3 or 9c building, or a Class 9a ward area, where the lights are adjacent roof lights
0.8 Note 3

ol.li: A maximum of two illumination power density adjustment factors for a control device can be applied to an area.

Where more than one illumination power density adjustment factor (other than for room aspect) applies to an area, they are to be combined using the following formula: A×(B/2+0.5) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahCart1ev3aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyqaiabgE na0kaacIcacaWGcbGaai4laiaaikdacqGHRaWkcaaIWaGaaiOlaiaa iwdacaGGPaaaaa@3F70@ R0lGODlhZgAVAPAAAP///wAAACwAAAAAZgAVAAACp4SPqcvtD6OctNqLs968Bo8Eosh8yYiRzfiZ kyq5hyvPpw0CNR6+uq+gBYe8G9Gw+x0frZ4Tudwln8aqMoSirqBPWVK4XEy/Wut1e4bWvllzuHye FuVIlvjtfZdZ/DkT7nezFqXHhWZFF+eQ17XnePdHuAiYxsgzWGSIWMKZFsamYhdB01fIN7ZiKZrZ odn6GgnLKkvrKZtYq4Gby9vr+wscLDxMHFwAACH/C01hdGhUeXBlMDAx/QUBAAcHRFNNVDcAARNX aW5BbGxCYXNpY0NvZGVQYWdlcwARBVRpbWVzIE5ldyBSb21hbgARA1N5bWJvbAARBUNvdXJpZXIg TmV3ABEETVQgRXh0cmEAEgAIIS9Fj0QvQVD0EA9HX0FQ8h8eQVD0FQ9BAPRF9CX0j0JfQQD0EA9D X0EA9I9F9CpfSPSPQQD0EA9A9I9Bf0j0EA9BKl9EX0X0X0X0X0EPDAEAAQABAgICAgACAAEBAQAD AAEABAAACgEAAgCDQQACBIbXALQCAIIoAAIAg0IAAgCCLwACAIgyAAIEhisAKwIAiDAAAgCCLgAC AIg1AAIAgikAAAAAIf8LTWF0aFR5cGUwMDP/PD94bWwgdmVyc2lvbj0iMS4wIj8+PCEtLSBNYXRo VHlwZUBUcmFuc2xhdG9yQDVANUBNYXRoTUwyIChDbGlwYm9hcmQpLnRkbEBNYXRoTUwgMi4wIChD bGlwYm9hcmQpQCAtLT48bWF0aCB4bWxucz0naHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMTk5OC9NYXRoL01h dGhNTCc+PG1yb3c+PG1pPkE8L21pPjxtbz4mI3gwMEQ3OzwvbW8+PG1vIHN0cmV0Y2h5PSdmYWxz ZSc+KDwvbW8+PG1pPkI8L21pPjxtbz4vPC9tbz48bW4+MjwvbW4+PG1vPis8L21vPjxtbj4wSi41 PC9tbj48bW8gc3RyZXRjaHk9J2ZhbHNlJz4pPC9tbz48L21yb3c+PC9tYXRoPjwhLS0gTWF0aFR5 cGVARW5kQDVANUAgLS0+ACH/C01hdGhUeXBlMDAyBgYAAAAAAAA7 A x (B + [(1 - B)/2]), where—

The adjustment factor does not apply to tungsten, halogen or other incandescent sources.
Includes luminaires with a pre-programmed function which provides dimming from ON to OFF (one-stage dimming).

The illumination power density adjustment factor is only applied to lights controlled by daylight sensors between 8:00 am and 7:00 pm.For lighting controlled by daylight sensors, the illumination power density adjustment factor is only applied between 8:00 am and 7:00 pm.
